about_the_game:
Create thrilling adventures with this revised and expanded Dungeon Master’s Guide for fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons. Inside this essential guide is everything new and experienced Dungeon Masters need to weave epic tales, build fantastical worlds, and inspire memorable moments for your party.

Pre-Order Information:

Introducing the 50th Anniversary Edition of the Dungeons & Dragons Dungeon Master's Guide, now available for pre-order on Fantasy Grounds! Secure your copy today, and it will be seamlessly linked to your Fantasy Grounds account, unlocking automatically as a new update on the official release date of November 12, 2024. Please note that this is a digital-only version, designed to provide you with the ultimate online tabletop experience. Don’t miss out on being part of this milestone in D&D history—pre-order now and prepare for endless quests and epic journeys!

Key Features: 

  • Intended for Dungeon Masters of all experience levels, this essential resource provides incredibly useful tools and advice for running your D&D game.     

  • Includes real-world examples of common pitfalls for Dungeon Masters, along with suggestions for how to handle them.  

  • 15 new, ready-to-use, reusable maps for homebrew adventures. 

  • Multiple handouts and resources for keeping track of campaigns.  

  • Presents Greyhawk as a customizable, ready-to-use campaign setting for Dungeon Masters. Set your adventures within Greyhawk or use it as a foundation for worlds you create. 

  • More than 400 new and improved treasures and magical items, including 18 brand new magical items. 

  • Contains rules for bastions, strongholds built and controlled by players. With crafting, base-building, and resource gathering, bastions are a fun between-session option for players. 

  • Easily find information on key D&D characters and locations with the Lore Glossary. 

  • Includes a detailed map depicting Eastern Oerik from the Greyhawk setting and the city of Greyhawk. 

Fantasy Grounds Features:

  • Hundreds of Magic Item Templates to use with the Magic Item Forge

  • Story Templates to use for random table-driven content generation

  • Bastions with facilities that can be dragged and dropped to expand and track each of your bastions

  • A readable reference manual to go with database records

  • Random treasure tables that generate treasure parcels

Adapted for Fantasy Grounds by: Doug Davison

Requires: An active subscription or a one time purchase of a Fantasy Grounds VTT license and the included D&D fifth edition ruleset. The Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook (2024 version) is recommended to take advantage of linked images and items from that source. The Dungeons & Dragons Monster Manual (2024 version) is recommended for linked information from that source that is present in several random tables.

Screenshots may differ from what you see in-game based on the extensions and ruleset you have loaded.
